intro: Tibouchina stellipilis, commonly known as the star-haired tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often surrounded by velvety, hairy bracts. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a slightly rough texture. Tibouchina stellipilis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various growing conditions.
